title: Pershing Square Reports Stake in Agilent Technologies
summary: Bill Ackman's hedge fund disclosed a 2.9 million-share stake in the laboratory instrument and software company. Bill Ackman's hedge fund Pershing Square Capital Management on Monday disclosed a 2.9 million-share stake in laboratory instrument and software company Agilent Technologies Inc.

title: Trump Set to Meet With Russia's Top Diplomat Tuesday
summary: Talks come as the U.S. leader faces an impeachment inquiry that could play into the hands of his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin. MOSCOW-President Trump is set to meet with Russia's top diplomat to discuss bilateral relations that in recent years have reached Cold War-era lows, with tensions flaring over Syria and Ukraine, and in the shadow of a high-stakes U.S. impeachment hearing.

title: Tiger Global Cuts Juul's Valuation to $19 Billion
summary: Firm was one of the e-cigarette's earliest investors; Juul writes down own valuation to $24 billion. Investment firm Tiger Global Management slashed its valuation of e-cigarette startup Juul Labs Inc. to $19 billion, a sign of a broader reassessment investors are making of several onetime Silicon Valley darlings.

title: Buttigieg to Name Clients From His Time at McKinsey
summary: The consulting firm said Monday it gave the Democratic candidate permission. Pete Buttigieg's Democratic presidential campaign said it would release a list of clients that he worked for during his nearly three years at McKinsey & Co., after the consulting firm gave him permission to disclose the information.

title: Big Drugmakers Push Deeper Into Cancer Treatment
summary: Merck to buy ArQule for $2.7 billion, while Sanofi moves to purchase Synthorx for $2.5 billion. Two of the world's biggest drugmakers struck multibillion-dollar deals on Monday aimed at bolstering their lineups in the fiercely competitive cancer-drugs market.

title: McAfee Considers Making Bid for Rival NortonLifeLock
summary: Consumer-software company has also been approached by private-equity firms. NortonLifeLock Inc., the $16 billion consumer-software company, has attracted deal interest from a handful of companies including rival McAfee LLC, people familiar with the matter said.

title: SEC Settles With Former Rep. Chris Collins, Two Others in Insider-Trading Case
summary: Collins resigned from his position representing New York's 27th Congressional District in September. The Securities and Exchange Commission has reached a settlement with former U.S. Rep. Christopher Collins, in connection with an insider-trading case involving his son and an Australian biotechnology company.

title: Index Provider MSCI Targets Acquisitions, Partnerships in 2020
summary: The company seeks to expand its index business related to corporate environmental, social and governance criteria. Index provider MSCI Inc. is pursuing a conservative strategy for 2020 by targeting complementary acquisitions and partnerships as it monitors a frothy deals market and prepares for a potential decline in stock markets, which could reduce fee income.

title: Madison, Schiff, Bribery and Impeachment
summary: If we are going to care about the Framers' intent (and we should), we have to do it honestly and accurately, without regard to partisan politics.. Jonathan Turley should reread his copy of James Madison's "Notes of Debates in the Federal Convention of 1787." In "Adam Schiff's Capacious Definition of Bribery Was Tried in 1787" (op-ed, Nov. 29), Mr. Turley says that the Framers "rejected" various definitions of impeachable offenses: "'corruption,' obtaining office by improper means, betraying one's trust to a foreign power, 'negligence,' 'perfidy,' 'peculation' and 'oppression.'"

title: We Can Win the Water Wars If We're Smart
summary: The good news is that these are solvable problems.. Regarding "Water Wars That Defined the West Are Heading East" (Page One, Dec. 3): This is an inevitable outcome of the water scarcity and quality issues that are growing nationally and globally, faster than solutions are being implemented. The good news is that these are solvable problems. A combination of investment in technology (such as desalination) and business-model innovation, along with intelligent consolidation and effective integration of the highly fragmented water and wastewater industry are bringing solutions to the market. We have plenty of water on the planet to take care of our needs. We simply need to focus in two areas: converting water to the quality required by the user (treatment), and getting water to where it is needed, when it is needed (conveyance). As an industry, we have abilities and lots of opportunities; we just need to go faster.

title: Judge Puts T-Mobile Merger Trial on Fast Track
summary: Lawyers for cellphone carriers and their state challengers are told to skip opening arguments. A federal judge told lawyers fighting over T-Mobile US Inc.'s more than $26 billion bid for Sprint Corp. to skip their customary opening arguments so they could start questioning witnesses, a sign he is seeking a speedy trial.

title: Negative-Rate Effects Like Quantum Physics
summary: It is inconceivable to me that the people would meekly submit to an interest-rate policy which requires a depositor to pay the bank to hold-and lend-their cash balances.. Regarding Paul Kupiec's "The Tax Code Can't Handle Negative Rates" (op-ed, Nov. 29): Notwithstanding the effects on tax policy, it is inconceivable to me that the people would meekly submit to an interest-rate policy which requires a depositor to pay the bank to hold-and lend-their cash balances.

title: Big Brands, Online Startups Find Success Rests on Store Shelves

title: Junk Bonds Set for Pain if Economic Pessimists Are Right
summary: A recession next year would trigger surge in defaults among the riskiest U.S. bonds, European investors say. summary: Missed deadlines have delayed the subway project's completion by three years, report finds. title: Another Parent Charged in College-Admissions Cheating Scheme

summary: The portfolio includes dividend-paying companies with potential for market-cap growth. (IVOIX) targets an overlooked opportunity, according to its managers: dividend-paying midcap stocks.
categories: Spotlight: Ivy Mid Cap Income Opportunities

title: Japan's Topix ETFs Continue to Attract Cash
summary: The funds have drawn big inflows from the Bank of Japan and others over the past three years. Japan doesn't get nearly the attention from global investors that it did in the glory years for its stock market. But exchange-traded funds that track the Tokyo Stock Price Index (Topix) have attracted heavy buying during the past three years.

title: Investors Are Subdued About a Quantum-Computing ETF
summary: Defiance Quantum ETF has yet to attract a lot of assets. The fund's backers say that is because the technology is in the early stages.. A quantum-computing breakthrough announced by Google in October illuminated the technology's potential-and an investment opportunity.

title: What Is Alternative Data?
summary: Data from unofficial or noncompany sources can offer investors key insights about an investment and shouldn't be ignored, financial experts say. The term "alternative facts" has been roundly ridiculed since its introduction into political discourse in 2017. There is, however, a similar phrase used in finance that investors should take seriously and understand: "alternative data."

title: China's Influencers-Moms, Farmers and Dogs-Hawk Their Wares on Live Streams
summary: China's influencer economy goes live; millions put in long hours selling products on the internet. HANGZHOU, China-A 21st-century version of the infomercial has become the hot, if occasionally risky, way to sell stuff in China's vast market.

title: Buyout Firm Leonard Green Raises Nearly $15 Billion for Two New Funds
summary: The firm brought in $2.75 billion for its debut middle-market focused fund and $12 billion is for its newest flagship buyout fund. Leonard Green & Partners, the Los Angeles-based buyout firm that has backed burger chain Shake Shack, apparel retailer J.Crew and U.K. fitness chain Pure Gym Ltd., has raised $14.75 billion for two new funds, including a middle-market focused fund, according to a person familiar with the matter.

title: New York City Jail Costs Reach Record Level
summary: City now spends a record $337,524 to incarcerate one person for a full year, or roughly $925 a day. The average daily cost of incarceration in New York City has reached a record level as officials work to overhaul the city's jail system, according to an official study of the city's Department of Correction published Friday.

title: As Albany Talks of Reform, Campaign Fundraising Chugs Along
summary: Gov. Cuomo celebrated his birthday at a soiree in which some attendees paid up to $25,000 per table. Gov. Andrew Cuomo turned 62 years old last week and celebrated his birthday as he has most of his nine years in office: by holding a fundraiser for his campaign committee.
